summary.p: Cantos (paṭalam) 1-12 of the Tēmpāvaṇi with the old commentary.

The mūlam of the Tēmpāvaṇi as it appears in this manuscript seems overall similar to that of the editio princeps, but there are some variations, especially in the pāyiram. The text of the commentary, on the other hand, seems to differ substantially in some cases (as in the commentary ad pāyiram 1 transcribed above), which would deserve further investigation.

support.p: The ms. is partially inked (for instance, fol. 253r, fols. 273-302).

extent.measure: Fols. 91-100 are missing; fol. 23 is misplaced, and found between fol. 38 and 39.

supportDesc.foliation: After the unnumbered front folia, folia 1-302 are numbered as 1-312, since folia 91-100 are missing. This is marked with Tamil numbers, likely put by the original scribe, on the left margin. Arabic numbers have been added later with a pencil on the right top corner of the leaves. Because of the missing folia, the Arabic numeration corresponds to the Tamil one in the beginning, but a discrepancy of 10 units begins after fol. 90.

handNote.desc: While the manuscript is in the scriptio continua and uses the traditional spelling (i.e. no differentiation between long “ē” and short “e”) it contains some rare occurrences of puḷḷi on top of the letter -ra- (also in fol.1r l.1 transcribed above).

decoNote.desc: Unnumbered front folio 1 recto has a large diagram of a cross.

additions.desc: Light annotations in black ink throughout the manuscripts.

additions.desc: An unknown reader has marked chapter numbers (using Tamil numerals) underneath the titles that appear on the left margin of the folia at the beginning of each chapter. Most likely the same reader has marked verse 13 of chapter 8, by going over its number and circling it with ink (fol. 151r). By mistake, she has dropped some ink on fol. 247v, where she has also marked a passage, perhaps because it was interesting or relevant, with a wavy line on the right margin. These annotations might be part of a coherent set with the more explicit annotations on ms. BnF Indien 475 (the second ms. of this MVM) that include dates, and might reflect one reading session.
